DISCLOSURE_INFO:
{
  "Allegations" : "CLIENT STATES CARTER RECOMMENDED VERISIGN STOCK AND INFORMED THE CLIENT THIS STOCK WOULD GO UP. THE CLIENT INVESTED $44,942 IN FEBRUARY 2001 AND HE INDICATED THE VALUE WAS NOW WORTH $4,500.  IN ADDITION, THE CLIENT STATES MARGIN LOANS WERE NOT AUTHORIZED AND ANY DIVIDENDS OR STOCKS USED TO PAY OFF LOANS WERE ALSO UNAUTHORIZED.   FILING REQUIRED, LOSSES EXCEED $5,000. ",
  "Damage Amount Requested" : "$5,000.00",
  "DisplayAAOLinkIfExists" : "N",
  "arbitrationClaimFiledDetail" : "",
  "arbitrationDocketNumber" : "",
  "Broker Comment" : "OUR RECORDS INDICATE THE CLIENT HAD MULTIPLE MARGIN LOANS WITH OUR FIRM AND THE ORIGINAL LOAN BEGAN ON FEBRUARY 7, 1997.  ON THIS DATE, A CHECK WAS ISSUED TO THE CLIENT IN THE AMOUNT OF $25,000.  A CHECK IN THE AMOUNT OF $20,068.78 WAS ALSO ISSUED FROM MARGIN ON JUNE 10, 1997.  THE IR INDICATED WHEN THE CLIENT WOULD CALL TO PLACE A TRADE AND THE CLIENT WOULD STATE, \"I AM GOING TO PAY FOR THIS ONE,\" MEANING THAT THE CLIENT WOULD BRING IN A CHECK RATHER THAN BUYING ON MARGIN, INDICATING THAT THE CLIENT WAS AWARE OF THE MARGIN ACCOUNT.  IN REGARDS TO THE DIVIDENDS PAID INTO HIS MARGIN ACCOUNT, IT APPEARS THE DIVIDENDS WERE REINVESTED.  ALL ACTIVITY WAS REFLECTED ON THE CLIENT'S CUSTOMER ACCOUNT STATEMENTS; THEREFORE, THE CLIENT SHOULD HAVE BEEN AWARE OF THE LOAN ACTIVITY OCCURRING IN THE ACCOUNT.  WHILE THE FIRM APPRECIATES THE CLIENT'S DISAPPOINTMENT IN THE DECLINE OF HIS VERISIGN STOCK, IT DOES APPEAR THE DECLINE IS A RESULT OF MARKET FLUCTUATION WHICH IS ONE OF THE RISKS ASSOCIATED WITH OWNING ANY INVESTMENT.  ACCORDING TO THE IR, THE CLIENT DESIRED AN AGGRESSIVE INVESTMENT AND WANTED TO MAKE MONEY QUICKLY.  THE IR STATED SHE EXPLAINED THE RISKS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS TYPE OF INVESTING, AND THAT SHE HAD CONVERSATIONS WITH THE CLIENT REGARDING THE STOCK PRICE DECLINING AND HE INDICATED HIS DESIRE TO HOLD THE STOCK.  BASED ON THE FINDINGS OF OUR INVESTIGATION, WE WILL NOT BE MAKING AN ADJUSTMENT TO THE CLIENT'S ACCOUNT. "
}

{
  "Allegations" : "CLIENT STATES HE HAS LOST $8,000.00 IN THE PAST YEAR DUE TO ADVICE HE RECEIVED FROM  CARTER.  CLIENT ALLEGES HE HAD TO LIQUIDATE HIS ACCOUNT TO PREVENT FURTHER LOSSES  AND THAT CARTER SHOULD HAVE INFORMED HIM HIS ACCOUNT WAS \"IN TROUBLE\", BUT DID NOT.",
  "Damage Amount Requested" : "$8,000.00",
  "DisplayAAOLinkIfExists" : "N",
  "arbitrationClaimFiledDetail" : "",
  "arbitrationDocketNumber" : "",
  "Broker Comment" : "CARTER HAS INDICATED THE CLIENTS INITIAL INVESTMENTS WITH HER WERE THE PURCHASE OF VAN KAMEN GROWTH AND INCOME FUND AND VAN KAMPEN EQUITY INCOME FUND. DUE TO THE CLIENT'S DISAPPOINTMENT IN THE GROWTH AND INCOME FUND, THE FUND WAS EXCHANGED FOR SHARES OF VAN KAMPEN EMERGING GROWTH FUND IN 1/00.  SHARES OF  INTEL CORP WERE PURCHASED IN 9/00 AND SOLD IN 9/01 AT WHICH TIME THE EMERGING GROWTH  FUND WAS ALSO SOLD.  AT THE TIME OF THE TRANSACTION (BUYS/SELLS), THE CLIENT RECEIVED TRADE CONFIRMATIONS AS WELL AS THE APPROPRIATE PROSPECTUS.  IN ADDITION, THE CLIENT HAS RECEIVED CUSTOMER STATEMENTS AND CARTER HAS INDICATED HE MADE FREQUENT VISITS TO HER OFFICE.  EXPLAINED WHILE WE UNDERSTAND THE CLIENT'S DISAPPOINTMENT IN THE  DECLINE IN THE VALUE OF SOME OF THE INVESTMENTS HELD IN THE ACCOUNT, THE DECLINE IS THE RESULT OF MARKET FLUCTATION WHICH IS A RISK ASSOCIATED WITH INVESTING."
}
